intro: Psychotria amboniana subsp. mosambicensis, commonly known as the Madagascar psychotria, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar and parts of Mozambique. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in forest understoreys. It produces small, berry-like fruits that are usually red or orange when mature. This species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and potential ethnobotanical uses.
